T·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a trong Khoa h·ªçc D·ªØ li·ªáu

Chuy·ªÉn sang ti·∫øng Anh

05-01 Quy Ho·∫°ch Tuy·∫øn T√≠nh (LP) B·∫Øt bu·ªôc

Quy ho·∫°ch tuy·∫øn t√≠nh (LP) l√† m·ªôt trong nh·ªØng k·ªπ thu·∫≠t t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a c∆° b·∫£n v√† ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª≠ d·ª•ng r·ªông r√£i nh·∫•t trong to√°n h·ªçc, kinh t·∫ø h·ªçc v√† k·ªπ thu·∫≠t. H√£y t∆∞·ªüng t∆∞·ª£ng b·∫°n l√† m·ªôt qu·∫£n l√Ω nh√† m√°y ƒëang c·ªë g·∫Øng t·ªëi ƒëa h√≥a l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n trong khi ph·∫£i ƒë·ªëi ph√≥ v·ªõi c√°c t√†i nguy√™n h·∫°n ch·∫ø - ƒë√¢y ch√≠nh x√°c l√† lo·∫°i b√†i to√°n m√† LP ƒë∆∞·ª£c thi·∫øt k·∫ø ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i quy·∫øt!

ƒêi·ªÅu g√¨ l√†m cho m·ªôt b√†i to√°n ‚ÄúTuy·∫øn t√≠nh‚Äù?

M·ªôt b√†i to√°n l√† tuy·∫øn t√≠nh khi:

  • H√†m m·ª•c ti√™u (th·ª© b·∫°n mu·ªën t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a) c√≥ m·ªëi quan h·ªá ƒë∆∞·ªùng th·∫≥ng
  • T·∫•t c·∫£ r√†ng bu·ªôc (gi·ªõi h·∫°n) c≈©ng c√≥ m·ªëi quan h·ªá ƒë∆∞·ªùng th·∫≥ng
  • Kh√¥ng c√≥ bi·∫øn n√†o ƒë∆∞·ª£c nh√¢n v·ªõi nhau (kh√¥ng c√≥ c√°c s·ªë h·∫°ng \(x_1 \cdot x_2\))
  • Kh√¥ng c√≥ bi·∫øn n√†o xu·∫•t hi·ªán trong s·ªë m≈© ho·∫∑c d∆∞·ªõi cƒÉn b·∫≠c hai

V√≠ d·ª• ƒê∆°n gi·∫£n: B√†i to√°n c·ªßa N√¥ng d√¢n

H√£y b·∫Øt ƒë·∫ßu v·ªõi m·ªôt v√≠ d·ª• tr·ª±c quan. M·ªôt n√¥ng d√¢n c√≥ 100 m·∫´u ƒë·∫•t v√† mu·ªën tr·ªìng ng√¥ v√† l√∫a m√¨ ƒë·ªÉ t·ªëi ƒëa h√≥a l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n:

  • Ng√¥: L·ª£i nhu·∫≠n $300 m·ªói m·∫´u, c·∫ßn 2 gi·ªù lao ƒë·ªông m·ªói m·∫´u
  • L√∫a m√¨: L·ª£i nhu·∫≠n $200 m·ªói m·∫´u, c·∫ßn 1 gi·ªù lao ƒë·ªông m·ªói m·∫´u
  • Lao ƒë·ªông c√≥ s·∫µn: T·ªïng c·ªông 150 gi·ªù

C√¢u h·ªèi: N√¥ng d√¢n n√™n tr·ªìng bao nhi√™u m·∫´u m·ªói lo·∫°i c√¢y tr·ªìng?

B√†i t·∫≠p T∆∞∆°ng t√°c: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√°c thanh tr∆∞·ª£t b√™n d∆∞·ªõi ƒë·ªÉ kh√°m ph√° c√°c t·ªï h·ª£p kh√°c nhau c·ªßa ng√¥ v√† l√∫a m√¨. Quan s√°t c√°ch l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n thay ƒë·ªïi v√† li·ªáu c√°c r√†ng bu·ªôc c√≥ ƒë∆∞·ª£c th·ªèa m√£n hay kh√¥ng!

T·ªïng lao ƒë·ªông s·ª≠ d·ª•ng: 150 / 150 gi·ªù
T·ªïng l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n: $25000
‚úì Nghi·ªám kh·∫£ thi

B√¢y gi·ªù h√£y ch√≠nh th·ª©c h√≥a tr·ª±c gi√°c n√†y. N·∫øu c·∫£ h√†m m·ª•c ti√™u v√† c√°c h√†m r√†ng bu·ªôc ƒë·ªÅu l√† affine, b√†i to√°n t·ªëi ∆∞u ƒë∆∞·ª£c g·ªçi l√† ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh tuy·∫øn t√≠nh (LP). Ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh tuy·∫øn t√≠nh t·ªïng qu√°t ƒë∆∞·ª£c ph√°t bi·ªÉu nh∆∞ sau:

LP T·ªïng qu√°t

\[\begin{align} &\text{minimize}_{x} &&{c^T x + d} \\\\ &\text{subject to } &&{Gx \preceq h}\\\\ & &&{Ax = b},\\\\ &\text{where } &&G \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n} \text{ and } A \in \mathbb{R}^{p \times n}. \end{align}\]
  • H·∫±ng s·ªë \(+d\) trong h√†m m·ª•c ti√™u kh√¥ng ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn qu√° tr√¨nh t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a ho·∫∑c k·∫øt qu·∫£ v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ b·ªè qua.
  • N·∫øu b·∫°n mu·ªën t·ªëi ƒëa h√≥a \(c^T x + d\) d∆∞·ªõi c√πng c√°c r√†ng bu·ªôc, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ t∆∞∆°ng ƒë∆∞∆°ng t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a \(-c^T x - d\).
  • B√†i to√°n tr√™n t√¨m nghi·ªám t·ªëi ∆∞u \(x^*\) c·ªßa h√†m affine \(c^T x + d\) tr√™n m·ªôt t·∫≠p kh·∫£ thi ƒëa di·ªán.

Gi·∫£i th√≠ch H√¨nh h·ªçc

S·ª©c m·∫°nh c·ªßa quy ho·∫°ch tuy·∫øn t√≠nh tr·ªü n√™n r√µ r√†ng khi ch√∫ng ta tr·ª±c quan h√≥a n√≥ theo h√¨nh h·ªçc. M·ªói r√†ng bu·ªôc ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a m·ªôt n·ª≠a kh√¥ng gian, v√† v√πng kh·∫£ thi l√† giao c·ªßa t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c n·ª≠a kh√¥ng gian n√†y - t·∫°o th√†nh m·ªôt ƒëa di·ªán.

Th√¥ng tin quan tr·ªçng: Nghi·ªám t·ªëi ∆∞u c·ªßa m·ªôt ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh tuy·∫øn t√≠nh lu√¥n xu·∫•t hi·ªán t·∫°i m·ªôt ƒë·ªânh (g√≥c) c·ªßa v√πng kh·∫£ thi! ƒê√¢y l√† l√Ω do t·∫°i sao ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p simplex ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông b·∫±ng c√°ch di chuy·ªÉn t·ª´ ƒë·ªânh n√†y sang ƒë·ªânh kh√°c.

LP ·ªü D·∫°ng chu·∫©n

T·∫°i sao ch√∫ng ta c·∫ßn m·ªôt d·∫°ng chu·∫©n? Nhi·ªÅu thu·∫≠t to√°n LP (nh∆∞ ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p simplex) ƒë∆∞·ª£c thi·∫øt k·∫ø ƒë·ªÉ l√†m vi·ªác v·ªõi m·ªôt ƒë·ªãnh d·∫°ng c·ª• th·ªÉ. Vi·ªác chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi v·ªÅ d·∫°ng chu·∫©n cho ph√©p ch√∫ng ta s·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√°c thu·∫≠t to√°n m·∫°nh m·∫Ω n√†y m·ªôt c√°ch nh·∫•t qu√°n.

LP d·∫°ng chu·∫©n

\[\begin{align} &\text{minimize}_{x} &&{c^T x + d} \\\\ &\text{subject to } &&{A x = b} \\\\ & &&{x \succeq 0}. \end{align}\]

ƒê·∫∑c ƒëi·ªÉm ch√≠nh c·ªßa d·∫°ng chu·∫©n:

  • M·ª•c ti√™u: Lu√¥n l√† t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a (c√°c b√†i to√°n t·ªëi ƒëa h√≥a ƒë∆∞·ª£c chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi b·∫±ng c√°ch l·∫•y √¢m)
  • R√†ng bu·ªôc: Ch·ªâ c√≥ r√†ng bu·ªôc ƒë·∫≥ng th·ª©c (b·∫•t ƒë·∫≥ng th·ª©c ƒë∆∞·ª£c chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi s·ª≠ d·ª•ng bi·∫øn slack)
  • Bi·∫øn: T·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c bi·∫øn ph·∫£i kh√¥ng √¢m
T·∫°i sao D·∫°ng chu·∫©n?
  • Hi·ªáu qu·∫£ thu·∫≠t to√°n: Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p Simplex l√†m vi·ªác tr·ª±c ti·∫øp tr√™n d·∫°ng chu·∫©n
  • Ph√¢n t√≠ch l√Ω thuy·∫øt: D·ªÖ d√†ng h∆°n ƒë·ªÉ ch·ª©ng minh c√°c ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán t·ªëi ∆∞u
  • Tri·ªÉn khai ph·∫ßn m·ªÅm: H·∫ßu h·∫øt c√°c b·ªô gi·∫£i LP mong ƒë·ª£i ƒë·∫ßu v√†o d·∫°ng chu·∫©n

T·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c LP t·ªïng qu√°t ƒë·ªÅu c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë∆∞·ª£c chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi v·ªÅ d·∫°ng chu·∫©n s·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√°c b∆∞·ªõc sau:

Chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi LP v·ªÅ d·∫°ng chu·∫©n

B∆∞·ªõc 1. S·ª≠ d·ª•ng bi·∫øn slack \(s\) ƒë·ªÉ chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi r√†ng bu·ªôc b·∫•t ƒë·∫≥ng th·ª©c th√†nh r√†ng bu·ªôc ƒë·∫≥ng th·ª©c:

\[\begin{align} &\text{minimize}_{x, s} &&{c^T x + d} \\\\ &\text{subject to } &&{Gx + s = h} \\\\ & &&{Ax = b},\\\\ & &&{s \succeq 0}. \end{align}\]

B∆∞·ªõc 2. Thay th·∫ø m·ªói bi·∫øn \(x\) b·∫±ng hai bi·∫øn kh√¥ng √¢m: \(x = x^{+} - x^{-}\), trong ƒë√≥ \(x^{+} \text{, } x^{-} \succeq 0\).

\[\begin{align} &\text{minimize}_{x^{+}, x^{-}, s} &&{c^Tx^{+} - c^Tx^{-} + d} \\\\ &\text{subject to } &&{Gx^{+} - Gx^{-} + s = h} \\\\ & &&{Ax^{+} - Ax^{-} = b},\\\\ & &&{s \succeq 0}\\\\ & &&{x^{+} \succeq 0}, {x^{-} \succeq 0}. \end{align}\]

B∆∞·ªõc 3. ƒê·ªãnh nghƒ©a \(\tilde{x}\), \(\tilde{c}\), \(\tilde{b}\), v√† \(\tilde{A}\) nh∆∞ sau:

\(\tilde{x} = \begin{bmatrix} x^{+} \\\\ x^{-} \\\\ s \end{bmatrix}, \tilde{c} = \begin{bmatrix} c \\\\ -c \\\\ 0 \end{bmatrix}, \tilde{b} = \begin{bmatrix} h \\\\ b \end{bmatrix}\), \(\tilde{A} = \begin{bmatrix} G & -G & I\\\\ A & -A & O \end{bmatrix}\)

B∆∞·ªõc 4. Th·∫ø \(\tilde{x}\), \(\tilde{c}\), \(\tilde{b}\), v√† \(\tilde{A}\) v√†o b√†i to√°n t·ª´ B∆∞·ªõc 2:

\[\begin{align} &\text{minimize}_{\tilde{x}} &&{\tilde{c}^T \tilde{x} + d} \\\\ &\text{subject to} &&{\tilde{A} \tilde{x} = \tilde{b}} \\\\ & &&{\tilde{x} \succeq 0}. \end{align}\]

V√≠ d·ª• - Ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh ch·∫ø ƒë·ªô ƒÉn u·ªëng

B√†i to√°n ch·∫ø ƒë·ªô ƒÉn u·ªëng l√† m·ªôt ·ª©ng d·ª•ng kinh ƒëi·ªÉn c·ªßa quy ho·∫°ch tuy·∫øn t√≠nh, l·∫ßn ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n ƒë∆∞·ª£c nghi√™n c·ª©u trong Th·∫ø chi·∫øn th·ª© hai ƒë·ªÉ t√¨m c√°ch nu√¥i d∆∞·ª°ng binh sƒ© m·ªôt c√°ch kinh t·∫ø nh·∫•t trong khi v·∫´n ƒë√°p ·ª©ng c√°c y√™u c·∫ßu dinh d∆∞·ª°ng.

Thi·∫øt l·∫≠p b√†i to√°n: T√¨m s·ª± k·∫øt h·ª£p th·ª©c ƒÉn r·∫ª nh·∫•t ƒë√°p ·ª©ng t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c y√™u c·∫ßu dinh d∆∞·ª°ng.

\[\begin{align} &\text{minimize}_{x} &&{c^T x} \\\\ &\text{subject to } &&{Dx \succeq d} \\\\ & &&{x \succeq 0}. \end{align}\]

Bi·∫øn v√† Tham s·ªë:

  • \(c_j\): Chi ph√≠ tr√™n m·ªói ƒë∆°n v·ªã th·ª©c ph·∫©m j ($/ƒë∆°n v·ªã)
  • \(d_i\): L∆∞·ª£ng ti√™u th·ª• t·ªëi thi·ªÉu khuy·∫øn ngh·ªã cho ch·∫•t dinh d∆∞·ª°ng i (ƒë∆°n v·ªã/ng√†y)
  • \(D_{ij}\): L∆∞·ª£ng ch·∫•t dinh d∆∞·ª°ng i trong th·ª©c ph·∫©m j (ƒë∆°n v·ªã ch·∫•t dinh d∆∞·ª°ng tr√™n ƒë∆°n v·ªã th·ª©c ph·∫©m)
  • \(x_j\): L∆∞·ª£ng th·ª©c ph·∫©m j trong ch·∫ø ƒë·ªô ƒÉn u·ªëng (ƒë∆°n v·ªã/ng√†y)
B·ªô T·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a Ch·∫ø ƒë·ªô ƒÉn u·ªëng T∆∞∆°ng t√°c: H√£y gi·∫£i m·ªôt b√†i to√°n ch·∫ø ƒë·ªô ƒÉn u·ªëng ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n v·ªõi 3 lo·∫°i th·ª©c ph·∫©m v√† 2 ch·∫•t dinh d∆∞·ª°ng!

Nh·∫•p "Gi·∫£i B√†i to√°n Ch·∫ø ƒë·ªô ƒÉn u·ªëng" ƒë·ªÉ xem nghi·ªám t·ªëi ∆∞u!
·ª®ng d·ª•ng th·ª±c t·∫ø:
  • H·∫≠u c·∫ßn qu√¢n s·ª±: Nu√¥i qu√¢n ƒë·ªôi m·ªôt c√°ch hi·ªáu qu·∫£ v·ªÅ chi ph√≠
  • L·∫≠p k·∫ø ho·∫°ch b·ªØa ƒÉn b·ªánh vi·ªán: ƒê√°p ·ª©ng y√™u c·∫ßu ch·∫ø ƒë·ªô ƒÉn u·ªëng c·ªßa b·ªánh nh√¢n
  • T·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a th·ª©c ƒÉn gia s√∫c: Dinh d∆∞·ª°ng gia s√∫c v·ªõi chi ph√≠ t·ªëi thi·ªÉu
  • Ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh b·ªØa tr∆∞a h·ªçc ƒë∆∞·ªùng: B·ªØa ƒÉn b·ªï d∆∞·ª°ng trong ph·∫°m vi ng√¢n s√°ch

Thu·∫≠t to√°n Simplex

Thu·∫≠t to√°n Simplex, ƒë∆∞·ª£c ph√°t tri·ªÉn b·ªüi George Dantzig nƒÉm 1947, l√† m·ªôt trong nh·ªØng thu·∫≠t to√°n quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong l·ªãch s·ª≠ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a. N√≥ ƒë√£ c√°ch m·∫°ng h√≥a quy ho·∫°ch tuy·∫øn t√≠nh b·∫±ng c√°ch cung c·∫•p m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p hi·ªáu qu·∫£ ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i c√°c b√†i to√°n LP m·ªôt c√°ch h·ªá th·ªëng.

T·∫°i sao Simplex ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông: ƒê·ªãnh l√Ω C∆° b·∫£n

ƒê·ªãnh l√Ω C∆° b·∫£n c·ªßa Quy ho·∫°ch Tuy·∫øn t√≠nh: N·∫øu m·ªôt ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh tuy·∫øn t√≠nh c√≥ nghi·ªám t·ªëi ∆∞u, th√¨ t·ªìn t·∫°i m·ªôt nghi·ªám t·ªëi ∆∞u xu·∫•t hi·ªán t·∫°i m·ªôt ƒë·ªânh (c·ª±c ƒëi·ªÉm) c·ªßa v√πng kh·∫£ thi.

ƒê·ªãnh l√Ω n√†y l√† th√¥ng tin quan tr·ªçng ƒë·∫±ng sau thu·∫≠t to√°n Simplex. Thay v√¨ t√¨m ki·∫øm to√†n b·ªô v√πng kh·∫£ thi (c√≥ th·ªÉ v√¥ h·∫°n), ch√∫ng ta ch·ªâ c·∫ßn ki·ªÉm tra s·ªë h·ªØu h·∫°n c√°c ƒë·ªânh!

How Simplex Works: The Strategy

The Simplex algorithm follows this elegant strategy:

  1. Start at any vertex of the feasible region
  2. Check if the current vertex is optimal
  3. Move to an adjacent vertex that improves the objective function
  4. Repeat until no improvement is possible (optimal solution found)

Simplex Algorithm Steps

Let‚Äôs walk through the algorithm step by step using our standard form LP:

\[\begin{align} &\text{minimize}_{x} &&{c^T x} \\\\ &\text{subject to } &&{A x = b} \\\\ & &&{x \succeq 0}. \end{align}\]

Step 1: Initial Setup

  • Convert the LP to standard form (if not already)
  • Find an initial basic feasible solution (vertex)
  • Set up the simplex tableau

Step 2: Optimality Test

  • Check if the current solution is optimal
  • If all reduced costs are non-negative, we‚Äôre done!

Step 3: Choose Entering Variable

  • Select the variable with the most negative reduced cost
  • This determines the direction to move

Step 4: Choose Leaving Variable

  • Use the minimum ratio test to avoid infeasibility
  • This determines how far to move

Step 5: Pivot Operation

  • Update the tableau using Gaussian elimination
  • Move to the new vertex

Step 6: Repeat

  • Go back to Step 2 until optimal

Interactive Simplex Example

Let‚Äôs solve a simple 2D problem step by step to see how Simplex works in practice:

Interactive Simplex Solver: Watch the algorithm move from vertex to vertex! **Problem:** $$\begin{align} \text{maximize } & 3x_1 + 2x_2 \\ \text{subject to } & x_1 + x_2 \leq 4 \\ & 2x_1 + x_2 \leq 6 \\ & x_1, x_2 \geq 0 \end{align}$$
Step 0: Starting at origin (0, 0)
Current objective value: 0
Click "Next Step" to begin the Simplex algorithm!
Current Simplex Tableau:
Click "Next Step" to see the tableau!

Why Simplex is Efficient

Despite having potentially exponential worst-case complexity, Simplex is remarkably efficient in practice:

Simplex Efficiency:
  • Average case: Typically visits only 2-3 times the number of constraints
  • Practical problems: Often solves in polynomial time
  • Warm starts: Can reuse previous solutions when problem changes slightly
  • Degeneracy handling: Modern implementations handle degenerate cases well

Simplex Variants and Modern Developments

Revised Simplex Method:

  • More numerically stable
  • Better for sparse matrices
  • Used in most commercial solvers

Dual Simplex Method:

  • Starts with dual feasible solution
  • Useful for sensitivity analysis
  • Better for certain problem types

Interior Point Methods:

  • Polynomial-time complexity guarantee
  • Better for very large problems
  • Complement rather than replace Simplex

Impact and Applications

The Simplex algorithm has transformed numerous industries:

Simplex Success Stories:
  • Airlines: Crew scheduling, route optimization, fleet assignment
  • Manufacturing: Production planning, supply chain optimization
  • Finance: Portfolio optimization, risk management
  • Telecommunications: Network flow optimization, bandwidth allocation
  • Energy: Power grid optimization, resource allocation
